result.execSummary:
The defendant Cary L Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 9 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cary L Mueller

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Character letters filed.

Defendant Cary L Mueller in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has completed treatment.  The State moves to amend count #1 to county ordinance.  The Court amends Count #1 accordingly, enters a no contest plea and finds the Defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read into count #1.  The Defendant was sentenced as follows:

Count #1:
FINE: $430.50 to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/6 or serve 9 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.
Jury status hearing on July 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

From Atty Kershek dated 6/10/16 requesting adjustment to jury status date and time. 
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 6/16/16.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on July 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Cary L Mueller in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises the Court the Defendant is in his second week of treatment and requests the Court set the matter for trial in 3 months when the Defendant is set to finish treatment.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Hearing at 04-14-2016 09:30 am
Conditions modified
Defendant to have no violent contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Cary L Mueller in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Kershek advises the Court that the parties are still in negotiations and the Defendant is in the process of enrolling in a 16 week treatment program.    Attorney Kershek is requesting that Court modify bail to no violent contact with the victim.  The victim G and his mother request the Court modify the bail.   The court modifies the bond to no violent contact.
Hearing at 02-29-2016 01:30 pm
Hearing at 02-15-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Cary L Mueller in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment at 01-19-2016 10:00 am
From Atty Kershek dated 12/21/15 requesting arraignment be adjourned due to conflict.
Arraignment at 01-05-2016 10:00 am
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Cary L Mueller in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Schleis appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Arraignment scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
